meanings.definition: To scatter or sprinkle drops or small amounts of something
meanings.sent1: I bedrop glitter on the craft project.
meanings.sent2: She likes to bedrop sugar on her pancakes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous fairy decided to bedrop tiny pebbles along the garden path.
meanings.sent4: The chef would bedrop secret ingredients into the soup.
meanings.sent5: The rain continued to bedrop on the roof all night.

meanings.definition: A small amount or drop of something, especially liquid
meanings.sent1: He noticed a bedrop of water on the leaf.
meanings.sent2: The bedrop of honey added sweetness to the tea.
meanings.sent3: The bedrop of paint on the canvas created a unique pattern.
meanings.sent4: She felt a bedrop of sweat roll down her forehead.
meanings.sent5: The bedrop of dew glistened in the morning sunlight.
